instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used for mechanical damage detection on waxy maize?
Output: For mechanical damage detection on waxy maize,the researchers used visible spectrum and nir s[ectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were employed for mechanical damage detection on waxy maize?
Output: PCA was used to reduce the spectral dimensions of HSI, remove noise, and reduce calculation costs in the proposed SSFE-FCNN. TODL extracted 3-D joint spectral-spatial tensor features from the 3-D sample data, and FCNN learned high-level features from the tensor features for pixel-wise classification.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the detection performance for mechanical damage detection on waxy maize, and how accurate was the SSFE-FCNN method in pixel-wise classification of waxy maize?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the detection performance of the SSFE-FCNN method in pixel-wise classification of waxy maize was overall accuracy. The SSFE-FCNN achieved an overall accuracy of 98.09% in the pixel-wise classification of waxy maize.

instruction: What is the role of the online tensor dictionary learning algorithm in the SSFE-FCNN classification method for mechanical damage detection on waxy maize?
Output: The role of the online tensor dictionary learning algorithm in the SSFE-FCNN classification method for mechanical damage detection on waxy maize is to extract spectral-spatial tensor features from the hyperspectral image (HSI) cubes. This algorithm helps in learning a dictionary of tensor atoms that can effectively represent the spectral-spatial information in the HSI data. By utilizing this dictionary, the SSFE-FCNN is able to extract high-level features from the tensor features and improve the detection performance for mechanical damage on waxy maize.

instruction: How does the SSFE-FCNN method compare to traditional methods in terms of overall accuracy for pixel-wise mechanical damage detection on waxy maize using hyperspectral imaging?
Output: The SSFE-FCNN method is superior to traditional methods in terms of overall accuracy for pixel-wise mechanical damage detection on waxy maize using hyperspectral imaging. The experimental results on the hyperspectral image of waxy maize show that the overall accuracy of SSFE-FCNN in the pixel-wise classification of waxy maize achieves as high as 98.09%. This indicates that the SSFE-FCNN method is highly accurate in detecting mechanical damage on waxy maize.
